title.value: Formation of giant plasma membrane vesicles for biological and medical applications: a review
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as mentioned in the document metadata.
title.quote: Formation of giant plasma membrane vesicles for biological and medical applications: a review

extractions.description: The paper provides an overview of the formation, properties, and biomedical applications of Giant Plasma Membrane Vesicles (GPMVs). It discusses their unique structure, functional properties, and use as cell mimics, plasma models, drug carriers, and probes for disease diagnostics.

type.justification: The paper does not present new experimental data but reviews existing research and provides theoretical discussions on the topic.
type.quote: In this review, we provide an overview of GPMVs, which includes their formation methods, their unique structural and functional properties, and their biomedical applications (Fig. 1).

name.justification: The core focus of the paper is on the use of GPMVs for mimicking biological membrane systems for various applications.
name.quote: Finally, we provide some perspectives on the challenges and future developments of PMV research in biomimetic science and biomedical applications.

name.justification: The paper discusses the use of GPMVs in different biomedical applications such as drug carriers, disease probes, etc.
name.quote: we discuss efforts to exploit them as cell mimics, plasma membrane models and drug carriers for biomedical applications in particular.

name.justification: The study revolves around the formation, structure, and composition of the plasma membrane.
name.quote: They retain the lipid and protein complexity of the plasma membrane of the parent cell while lack the energy-mediated pathway of the cell.
